headline.print_headline: Pryor's 'Obamacare' Ad Highlights His Cancer Fight
headline.main: Pryor's 'Obamacare' Ad Highlights His Cancer Fight

docs.snippet: U.S. Sen. Mark Pryor reached into his own medical history Tuesday to explain his vote on the nation's new health care law, telling Arkansans his battle with a rare cancer 18 years ago influenced him....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Sen. Mark Pryor reached into his own medical history Tuesday to explain his vote on the nation's new health care law, telling Arkansans his battle with a rare cancer 18 years ago influenced him.

headline.print_headline: CEO: Kidnappers Threatened Foley's Life Last Week
headline.main: CEO: Kidnappers Threatened Foley's Life Last Week

docs.snippet: The chief executive officer of a Boston-based news organization says James Foley's kidnappers last week threatened to kill him in response to U.S. bombings in Iraq....
docs.lead_paragraph: The chief executive officer of a Boston-based news organization says James Foley's kidnappers last week threatened to kill him in response to U.S. bombings in Iraq.

headline.print_headline: New Hampshire Town Sued for Harassing Panhandlers
headline.main: New Hampshire Town Sued for Harassing Panhandlers

docs.snippet: A civil liberties group on Wednesday sued the police department of a New Hampshire town for what it says is a pattern of harassing panhandlers in violation of their constitutional rights....
docs.lead_paragraph: A civil liberties group on Wednesday sued the police department of a New Hampshire town for what it says is a pattern of harassing panhandlers in violation of their constitutional rights.

headline.print_headline: HP in Better Position Now to Make Acquisitions: CEO
headline.main: HP in Better Position Now to Make Acquisitions: CEO

docs.snippet: Hewlett-Packard Co is in a better position today to make acquisitions than in the past year, given its $4.7 billion in net cash and as it evaluates its overall cloud software capability, Chief Executive Officer Meg Whitman said in an interview....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hewlett-Packard Co is in a better position today to make acquisitions than in the past year, given its $4.7 billion in net cash and as it evaluates its overall cloud software capability, Chief Executive Officer Meg Whitman said in an interview.

headline.sub: Tumultuous protests aim to oust Sharif in Pakistan
headline.main: Tumultuous protests aim to oust Sharif in Pakistan

docs.snippet: Opposition politicians in Pakistan lead protesters to the steps of parliament, demanding Prime Minister Sharif resign. Gavino Garay reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Opposition politicians in Pakistan lead protesters to the steps of parliament, demanding Prime Minister Sharif resign. Gavino Garay reports.

headline.sub: U.S. will be relentless against Islamic State after beheading: Obama
headline.main: U.S. will be relentless against Islamic State after beheading: Obama

docs.snippet: President Obama is vowing to fight Islamic State after the militant group beheaded American journalist, James Foley. At a news conference, the president said "When people harm Americans anywhere, we do what's necessary to see that justice is done....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama is vowing to fight Islamic State after the militant group beheaded American journalist, James Foley. At a news conference, the president said "When people harm Americans anywhere, we do what's necessary to see that justice is done." Jillian Kitchener reports.

headline.print_headline: On Day 2 After Miller's Injury, Buckeyes Moving On
headline.main: On Day 2 After Miller's Injury, Buckeyes Moving On

docs.snippet: When star quarterback Braxton Miller cried out in pain and crumpled to the ground during No. 5 Ohio State's practice on Monday, coach Urban Meyer wasn't certain what had happened....
docs.lead_paragraph: When star quarterback Braxton Miller cried out in pain and crumpled to the ground during No. 5 Ohio State's practice on Monday, coach Urban Meyer wasn't certain what had happened.

headline.print_headline: Drought Has State Debating Its Unregulated Pumping
headline.main: Drought Has State Debating Its Unregulated Pumping

docs.snippet: Three years of drought have Californians debating an end to the state's status as one of the last in the West with a pump-as-you-please policy for the vital underground sources that provide up to 65 percent of the state's water....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three years of drought have Californians debating an end to the state's status as one of the last in the West with a pump-as-you-please policy for the vital underground sources that provide up to 65 percent of the state's water.

headline.main: President Obama on James Foley, and Muslim Victims

docs.snippet: The point that the extremist group’s victims are overwhelmingly Muslim is worth repeating....

headline.print_headline: Obama Weighs Broader Move on Legal Immigration
headline.main: Obama Weighs Broader Move on Legal Immigration

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is considering key changes in the nation's immigration system requested by tech, industry and powerful interest groups, in a move that could blunt Republicans' election-year criticism of the president's go-it-alone approach ...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is considering key changes in the nation's immigration system requested by tech, industry and powerful interest groups, in a move that could blunt Republicans' election-year criticism of the president's go-it-alone approach to immigration.
